channel.title: Tests on PHI 14
channel.description: Recent content in Tests on PHI 14

item.title: Test 2
item.description: This test is designed to take one hour. Complete it during the exam period (designated as 10:30–12:30). Tests submitted by 12:45 PM on May 19 will be on time. Submit through the upload link at [the course Blackboard site] > Tests > Test 2. Note that the Turnitin interface is apparently new. Instructions Choose six (6) of the questions below under “Questions” to work on. For each of those six questions, write a one-paragraph answer, not shorter than five sentences.

item.title: Test 1
item.description: This test is designed to take one hour. You may complete it during the class session, or you may submit it later in the day. Tests submitted any time on March 24 will be on time. Submit through the upload link at the course Blackboard site > Tests > Test 1. Instructions Choose five (5) of the questions below under “Questions” to work on. For each of those five questions, write a one-paragraph answer, not shorter than five sentences.

item.title: Test 1 Information
item.description: The first test, on Wednesday March 24, will be released at the beginning of the class session (11:20 AM) through a Blackboard announcement. The test is designed to take one hour. You may complete it during the class session, or you may submit it later in the day. Tests submitted any time on March 24 will be on time. Submit through the upload link at the course Blackboard site > Tests > Test 1.

item.title: Test 2 Information
item.description: Instructions The test will be desinged take you not more than 90 minutes. This is a final assessment, not a big project. You should type out your answers in your own document. Our second test, on Wednesday May 19, will be released at the beginning of the test period (10:30 AM) through a Blackboard announcement (which will also automatically go, more or less immediately, to your email). The test will be due by upload at the end of the session (12:30 PM), except for those students who have arranged additional time as allowed by Student Access Services (note:arrange with me directly unless you prefer to arrange with SAS).
